We hope that we can get as many volunteers as possible to publish their code on
this website. This section provides a full list of posts, their authors as well
as other meta data.

```{r, layout="l-page"}
library(DT)

jsonlite::fromJSON(
  "https://raw.githubusercontent.com/mrcaseb/open-source-football/master/docs/posts/posts.json",
  flatten = TRUE
) %>%
  tidyr::unnest_wider(author) %>% 
  dplyr::select(name, url, date, title, path) %>%
  DT::datatable(
    extensions = c('FixedHeader'),

      # set some options
      options = list(

        # Show table and table info
        # dom = "ti",

        # format all columns to align center
        # no searching or ordering for the rownames col
        # only descending order starting with col 2
        columnDefs = list(
          list(className = 'dt-center', targets = "_all")
          # list(targets = 1,
          #      render = JS(
          #        "function(data, type, row, meta) {",
          #        "return '<img src=\"' + data + '\" height=\"10%\">';",
          #        "}"))
          # list(orderSequence = c("desc"), targets = c(2:7))
          ),

        # Highlight order column
        orderClasses = TRUE,

        # fix the table header
        fixedHeader = TRUE

        ),

      # create index column with this callback. The if else statement only work
      # with the rendertDT option `server = FALSE` but this breaks the ggplot
      # callback = JS(
      #   "table.on('order.dt, search.dt', function () {
      #      var torder = table.order();
      #     table.column(0, {search:'none', order:'current'}).nodes().each( function (cell, i) {
      #       if (torder[0][1] === 'asc') {
      #         cell.innerHTML = table.page.info().recordsDisplay-i;
      #       }
      #       else {
      #         cell.innerHTML = i+1;
      #       }
      #       table.cell(cell).invalidate('dom');
      #     } );
      #   } ).draw();"
      # ),

      # change column names
      colnames = c("Author", "Contact", "Published", "Title", "URL"),

      rownames = FALSE,

      # enable column filtering and put the filter at the top (can be bottom as well)
      filter = "bottom",
      escape = TRUE
    ) %>%

    # format some columns with a number of decimal digits
    DT::formatDate(columns = 3)
```
